rules.title: Do you have rigorous requirements reviews and sign-offs?
Do you have a clear traceability matrix?
Do you maintain your traceability matrix?
Does your traceability matrix link requirements to design elements, code modules, test cases, and ultimately, the delivered product?
rules.description: This helps ensure that everything built can be traced back to a specific requirement and that all requirements are addressed.

rules.title: Do you control changes to requirements?
Do you have a formal process for managing changes to requirements?
Do you have coding standards and guidelines?
Do you enforce use of coding standards and guidelines?
Do you have a comprehensive system design?
Does your system architecture consider non-functional requirements like scalability, performance, security, and maintainability?
Do you have a design review process
Does your design review involve senior developers?
rules.description: to identify potential issues and ensure alignment with best practices.

rules.title: Does your design review involve relevant stakeholders?
rules.description: to identify potential issues and ensure alignment with requirements.

rules.title: Do you use Architecture as Code approach?
Do you maintain the current system design?
rules.description: Review and analyse current design and amend it to keep it up to date.

rules.title: Do you have a code review process?
Is code review a compulsory part of the development life cycle?
